thread.title: Suspected bicycle thief caught with 164 bikes in his back garden | Metro News
thread.title_full: Suspected bicycle thief caught with 164 bikes in his back garden | Metro News

author: Nicole Morley For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Suspected bicycle thief caught with 164 bikes in his back garden | Metro News
text:
Nicole Morley for Metro.co.uk Saturday 11 Feb 2017 4:54 pm 160+ bikes seized as a result of a house search following the arrest of a male in oxford. If we find yours, we will be in touch #TVP pic.twitter.com/AkTPYQOShi 
— TVP Oxford (@TVP_Oxford) February 7, 2017 
A suspected serial bicycle thief has been arrested after an enormous haul of 164 bikes were discovered in his back garden. 
The 48-year-old was detained after he was caught carrying one bike and another he was seen pushing down the street were both registered as stolen. Woman almost died after using wrong type of tampon 
Police said that they were now sifting through the backyard peloton to to see which bikes had been reported stolen by owners. 
The stash was found at the home in the Littlemore area of Oxford, where police arrested the man on suspicion of handling stolen goods. 
He has been released on police bail until May 8 while investigations continue. 
In a tweet Thames Valley Police said: ‘If we find yours, we will be in touch.’ 
PCSO Ryan Tappin, one of the team tasked with checking the bikes, said: ‘I’ve never seen anything like this before. I’ve recovered two or three bikes from a property on the off chance, but never 164 in one go.’ More
